meanings.def: a man who is polite and well educated, who has excellent manners and always behaves well
examples: You acted like a true gentleman.
He was always the perfect gentleman.
He was too much of a gentleman to ask them for any money.

meanings.def: used to address or refer to a man, especially somebody you do not know
examples: Ladies and gentlemen! Can I have your attention, please?
She was talking to an elderly gentleman.
Ladies and gentlemen of the jury!
There's a gentleman to see you.

meanings.def: used to address or refer to a male member of a legislature, for example the House of Representatives
a man from a high social class, especially one who does not need to work
examples: He retired to his estate and lived the life of a country gentleman.
a gentleman farmer (= one who owns a farm for pleasure, not as his main job)

meanings.def: a man/woman who does not have to work

idioms.def: a man/woman who does not have to work
